intro: Harpalyce hilariana, commonly known as the Arizona harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its deep root system. It produces small, hard pods that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Harpalyce hilariana is often found in rocky soils and is a component of the local desert flora.
